title: YIKES! Sorry Riot Leaver Buster
body: YIKES! Sorry Riot I Got a leaver Buster because I had to go pick help my brother from falling off his trampoline and severely hurting himself. Sorry riot forgive me all powerful gods for being a human being and helping my brother with his bleeding knee because this game is all important. Better type "I agree" to not help my brother when he is hurt and screaming for help. :/ This company is a joke. Especially when I come back to the game before its over....

replies.body:
You should absolutely help your brother if he ever hurts himself, regardless of whether League exists or not. Nobody would blame you for that. However, that doesn't exactly translate over to the punishment here. It's good you chose to take care of your brother for sure, and that's far more important than one game of League, but it doesn't erase what happened either.

Also, you won't ever get a leaverbuster from just one left game!

Which I did and I returned to the game too and lost exp. I just dont think i should be punished for that. Also it was a bot game. 

Also what do you even mean "it doesnt erase what happened" ??? that completely contridicts everything you just said, your basically saying "yea you should definately help your brother by all means, "BUT" you still left a game and it doesnt change that" <<< thats so heartless. LOL

There is absolutely no proof to your story. Riot is not obligated to look at hundreds of thousands of left games per *day* and determine if the reason was valid or not. The system treats **every** leave equally - someone leaves a game, they don't get credit for the game.

You were not "punished" - a punishment would have involved a "Low Priority Queue" for 5 games (starting at 5 up to 20 minutes) - where you'd have to wait before joining the queue. That only happens on players that leave very frequently. If you only run into the occasional emergency such as this you will not receive an actual punishment from LeaverBuster.
k. thanks for being a human being :3 Ill take a picture of his bandaged leg now and get you your proof.

There is simply not enough manpower for the cases to all be reviewed by humans, and it would be unfair. The system as it is now treats everyone the same - anyone leaving a game is subject to possible action or punishment. This is regardless of if they are ragequitting every other game, or if every other game their power goes out/mom calls for dinner/they have to go to work/etc. Both situations result in the same outcome - a team is left without a player. Hence why you were marked a leaver and did not receive any rewards for the game.

Your responses come off extremely sarcastic and unappreciative of the responses you're getting. All you had to do was type "I agree" to the message you were given - which is not a punishment. It's informing you of the rules that are established. You have to agree to a set of rules when you create accounts or download almost any game now-a-days. By your logic, you were also punished simply for creating your account, as you had to agree to a set of rules to create it. Leave buster punishments come in the form of low priority queue, which gives you extended queue times. All you need to do is go AFK for at least a few minutes, and you'll be marked as AFK for a game. A few minutes can truly make a huge difference in the outcome of a match. Real life emergencies always comes first, and Riot understands. If you don't intentionally leave games because you're mad about something or someone, and you only leave during emergencies or circumstances out of your control, then you won't have much of a record of leaving games. And as a result, when you do unfortunately have to AFK or leave, you likely won't be punished for it.
